hints: One of the seven main landmasses of the Earth
Asia and Africa are examples of this
A large, continuous expanse of land
A large natural elevation of the Earth's surface
The Alps and the Himalayas are examples of this
It is significantly higher than the surrounding land
A very large expanse of sea
Pacific and Atlantic are the two largest examples
Covers about 71% of the Earth's surface
A large natural stream of water flowing in a channel to the sea
The Nile and the Amazon are famous examples
A natural waterway
A barren area of landscape where little precipitation occurs
The Sahara is the largest hot one
Has very little plant life due to extreme climate
A low area of land between hills or mountains
Often contains a river or stream
Carved out by erosion
A piece of land surrounded by water on all sides
Greenland is the largest example of this
The country of Japan is composed of many of these
A piece of land almost surrounded by water or projecting out into a body of water
Florida and Korea are examples of this
It is connected to a larger landmass
A narrow passage of water connecting two seas or two large areas of water
The Strait of Gibraltar connects the Atlantic Ocean to the Mediterranean Sea
It is a channel of water
A group of islands clustered together in a sea or ocean
Indonesia and Hawaii are examples of this
The word comes from Greek for 'chief sea'
An area of flat, high ground
Also known as a tableland
The Tibetan one is the world's largest
A slowly moving mass or river of ice
Formed by the accumulation and compaction of snow
Can carve out valleys
An artificial waterway constructed to allow the passage of boats or ships inland
The Panama and Suez are famous examples
It connects two bodies of water
A mountain or hill with a crater from which lava, rock fragments, hot vapor, and gas erupt
Mount Vesuvius and Mount Fuji are examples
It is a vent in the Earth's crust
A large body of water surrounded by land
The Great Lakes are a famous group of these
It is typically freshwater
A large inlet from the sea into the landmass
The Gulf of Mexico is a large example
Larger than a bay
A broad inlet of the sea where the land curves inwards
San Francisco is located on one of these
Smaller than a gulf
A long, narrow, deep inlet of the sea between high cliffs
Common in Norway and New Zealand
Carved by glaciers
A deep gorge, typically one with a river flowing through it
The Grand Canyon is a famous example
Formed by erosion over a long period
A landform created by the deposition of sediment at the mouth of a river
The Nile River has a famous one
Often shaped like a triangle
A vast, flat, treeless Arctic region of Europe, Asia, and North America
The soil is permanently frozen
Characterized by permafrost
An area of tropical forest where trees and plants grow very thickly
A type of dense rainforest
The Amazon is a famous example
A grassy plain in tropical or subtropical regions
Characterized by a mix of grass and scattered trees
Often found in Africa
The study of the physical features of the earth and its atmosphere
Means 'earth writing' in Greek
The field of study for this word list
A diagrammatic representation of an area of land or sea
Used to navigate and find locations
Can show physical features and political boundaries
An imaginary line drawn around the Earth equally distant from both poles
It divides the Earth into the Northern and Southern Hemispheres
Has a latitude of 0 degrees
A half of the Earth, usually divided by the equator or prime meridian
Northern, Southern, Eastern, and Western are the four main types
Half of a sphere
The angular distance of a place north or south of the Earth's equator
Lines run horizontally on a map
Lines of parallel
The angular distance of a place east or west of the prime meridian
Lines run vertically on a map

It passes through Greenwich, England
Divides the Earth into Eastern and Western Hemispheres
The envelope of gases surrounding the Earth
It is held in place by gravity
Protects the planet from radiation
A large naturally occurring community of flora and fauna occupying a major habitat
Examples include deserts, forests, and grasslands
A major ecological community
A river or stream flowing into a larger river or lake
It contributes to a larger body of water
The Ohio River is one to the Mississippi
The tidal mouth of a large river, where the tide meets the stream

Where a river meets the sea
A long, narrow, deep inlet of the sea between high cliffs
Common in Norway and New Zealand
Carved by glaciers
A barrier constructed to hold back water and raise its level

The rigid outer part of the earth, consisting of the crust and upper mantle

The solid part of the planet
All the waters on the earth's surface, such as lakes and seas
Includes water vapor in the atmosphere
The total amount of water on the planet
The regions of the surface, atmosphere, and hydrosphere of the earth occupied by living organisms

Cause of earthquakes
A ridge of rock in the sea formed by the growth and deposit of coral skeletons
The Great Barrier Reef is the largest example
An underwater ecosystem
A long, high sea wave caused by an earthquake, submarine landslide, or other disturbance

A series of waves
